18#include "AZEncoder.h"
19#include "AZHighLevelEncoder.h"
20#include "BitArray.h"

26#include <cstdlib>
27#include <stdexcept>
28#include <vector>

30namespace ZXing {
31namespace Aztec {
32
33static const int MAX_NB_BITS = 32;
34static const int MAX_NB_BITS_COMPACT = 4;
35
36static const int WORD_SIZE[] = {
37 4, 6, 6, 8, 8, 8, 8, 8, 8, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10,
38 12, 12, 12, 12, 12, 12, 12, 12, 12, 12
39};
40
41static void DrawBullsEye(BitMatrix& matrix, int center, int size)
42{
43 for (int i = 0; i < size; i += 2) {
44 for (int j = center - i; j <= center + i; j++) {
45 matrix.set(j, center - i);
46 matrix.set(j, center + i);
47 matrix.set(center - i, j);
48 matrix.set(center + i, j);
49 }
50 }
51 matrix.set(center - size, center - size);
52 matrix.set(center - size + 1, center - size);
53 matrix.set(center - size, center - size + 1);
54 matrix.set(center + size, center - size);
55 matrix.set(center + size, center - size + 1);
56 matrix.set(center + size, center + size - 1);
57}
58
59
60static const GenericGF& GetGFFromWordSize(int wordSize)
61{
62 switch (wordSize) {
63 case 4:
64 return GenericGF::AztecParam();
65 case 6:
66 return GenericGF::AztecData6();
67 case 8:
68 return GenericGF::AztecData8();
69 case 10:
70 return GenericGF::AztecData10();
71 case 12:
72 return GenericGF::AztecData12();
73 default:
74 throw std::invalid_argument("Unsupported word size " + std::to_string(wordSize));
75 }
76}
77
78static std::vector<int> BitsToWords(const BitArray& stuffedBits, int wordSize, int totalWords)
79{
80 std::vector<int> message(totalWords, 0);
81 int i;
82 int n;
83 for (i = 0, n = stuffedBits.size() / wordSize; i < n; i++) {
84 int value = 0;
85 for (int j = 0; j < wordSize; j++) {
86 value |= stuffedBits.get(i * wordSize + j) ? (1 << (wordSize - j - 1)) : 0;
87 }
88 message[i] = value;
89 }
90 return message;
91}
92
93static void GenerateCheckWords(const BitArray& bitArray, int totalBits, int wordSize, BitArray& messageBits)
94{
95 // bitArray is guaranteed to be a multiple of the wordSize, so no padding needed
96 int messageSizeInWords = bitArray.size() / wordSize;
97 ReedSolomonEncoder rs(GetGFFromWordSize(wordSize));
98 int totalWords = totalBits / wordSize;
99 std::vector<int> messageWords = BitsToWords(bitArray, wordSize, totalWords);
100 rs.encode(messageWords, totalWords - messageSizeInWords);
101 int startPad = totalBits % wordSize;
102 messageBits = BitArray();
103 messageBits.appendBits(0, startPad);
104 for (int messageWord : messageWords) {
105 messageBits.appendBits(messageWord, wordSize);
106 }
107}
108
109ZXING_EXPORT_TEST_ONLY
110void GenerateModeMessage(bool compact, int layers, int messageSizeInWords, BitArray& modeMessage)
111{
112 modeMessage = BitArray();
113 if (compact) {
114 modeMessage.appendBits(layers - 1, 2);
115 modeMessage.appendBits(messageSizeInWords - 1, 6);
116 GenerateCheckWords(modeMessage, 28, 4, modeMessage);
117 }
118 else {
119 modeMessage.appendBits(layers - 1, 5);
120 modeMessage.appendBits(messageSizeInWords - 1, 11);
121 GenerateCheckWords(modeMessage, 40, 4, modeMessage);
122 }
123}
124
125static void DrawModeMessage(BitMatrix& matrix, bool compact, int matrixSize, const BitArray& modeMessage)
126{
127 int center = matrixSize / 2;
128 if (compact) {
129 for (int i = 0; i < 7; i++) {
130 int offset = center - 3 + i;
131 if (modeMessage.get(i)) {
132 matrix.set(offset, center - 5);
133 }
134 if (modeMessage.get(i + 7)) {
135 matrix.set(center + 5, offset);
136 }
137 if (modeMessage.get(20 - i)) {
138 matrix.set(offset, center + 5);
139 }
140 if (modeMessage.get(27 - i)) {
141 matrix.set(center - 5, offset);
142 }
143 }
144 }
145 else {
146 for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
147 int offset = center - 5 + i + i / 5;
148 if (modeMessage.get(i)) {
149 matrix.set(offset, center - 7);
150 }
151 if (modeMessage.get(i + 10)) {
152 matrix.set(center + 7, offset);
153 }
154 if (modeMessage.get(29 - i)) {
155 matrix.set(offset, center + 7);
156 }
157 if (modeMessage.get(39 - i)) {
158 matrix.set(center - 7, offset);
159 }
160 }
161 }
162}
163
164ZXING_EXPORT_TEST_ONLY
165void StuffBits(const BitArray& bits, int wordSize, BitArray& out)
166{
167 out = BitArray();
168 int n = bits.size();
169 int mask = (1 << wordSize) - 2;
170 for (int i = 0; i < n; i += wordSize) {
171 int word = 0;
172 for (int j = 0; j < wordSize; j++) {
173 if (i + j >= n || bits.get(i + j)) {
174 word |= 1 << (wordSize - 1 - j);
175 }
176 }
177 if ((word & mask) == mask) {
178 out.appendBits(word & mask, wordSize);
179 i--;
180 }
181 else if ((word & mask) == 0) {
182 out.appendBits(word | 1, wordSize);
183 i--;
184 }
185 else {
186 out.appendBits(word, wordSize);
187 }
188 }
189}
190
191static int TotalBitsInLayer(int layers, bool compact)
192{
193 return ((compact ? 88 : 112) + 16 * layers) * layers;
194}
195
196/**
197* Encodes the given binary content as an Aztec symbol
198*
199* @param data input data string
200* @param minECCPercent minimal percentage of error check words (According to ISO/IEC 24778:2008,
201* a minimum of 23% + 3 words is recommended)
202* @param userSpecifiedLayers if non-zero, a user-specified value for the number of layers
203* @return Aztec symbol matrix with metadata
204*/
205EncodeResult
206Encoder::Encode(const std::string& data, int minECCPercent, int userSpecifiedLayers)
207{
208 // High-level encode
209 BitArray bits = HighLevelEncoder::Encode(data);
210
211 // stuff bits and choose symbol size
212 int eccBits = bits.size() * minECCPercent / 100 + 11;
213 int totalSizeBits = bits.size() + eccBits;
214 bool compact;
215 int layers;
216 int totalBitsInLayer;
217 int wordSize;
218 BitArray stuffedBits;
219 if (userSpecifiedLayers != DEFAULT_AZTEC_LAYERS) {
220 compact = userSpecifiedLayers < 0;
221 layers = std::abs(userSpecifiedLayers);
222 if (layers > (compact ? MAX_NB_BITS_COMPACT : MAX_NB_BITS)) {
223 throw std::invalid_argument("Illegal value for layers: " + std::to_string(userSpecifiedLayers));
224 }
225 totalBitsInLayer = TotalBitsInLayer(layers, compact);
226 wordSize = WORD_SIZE[layers];
227 int usableBitsInLayers = totalBitsInLayer - (totalBitsInLayer % wordSize);
228 StuffBits(bits, wordSize, stuffedBits);
229 if (stuffedBits.size() + eccBits > usableBitsInLayers) {
230 throw std::invalid_argument("Data to large for user specified layer");
231 }
232 if (compact && stuffedBits.size() > wordSize * 64) {
233 // Compact format only allows 64 data words, though C4 can hold more words than that
234 throw std::invalid_argument("Data to large for user specified layer");
235 }
236 }
237 else {
238 wordSize = 0;
239 // We look at the possible table sizes in the order Compact1, Compact2, Compact3,
240 // Compact4, Normal4,... Normal(i) for i < 4 isn't typically used since Compact(i+1)
241 // is the same size, but has more data.
242 for (int i = 0; ; i++) {
243 if (i > MAX_NB_BITS) {
244 throw std::invalid_argument("Data too large for an Aztec code");
245 }
246 compact = i <= 3;
247 layers = compact ? i + 1 : i;
248 totalBitsInLayer = TotalBitsInLayer(layers, compact);
249 if (totalSizeBits > totalBitsInLayer) {
250 continue;
251 }
252 // [Re]stuff the bits if this is the first opportunity, or if the
253 // wordSize has changed
254 if (wordSize != WORD_SIZE[layers]) {
255 wordSize = WORD_SIZE[layers];
256 StuffBits(bits, wordSize, stuffedBits);
257 }
258 int usableBitsInLayers = totalBitsInLayer - (totalBitsInLayer % wordSize);
259 if (compact && stuffedBits.size() > wordSize * 64) {
260 // Compact format only allows 64 data words, though C4 can hold more words than that
261 continue;
262 }
263 if (stuffedBits.size() + eccBits <= usableBitsInLayers) {
264 break;
265 }
266 }
267 }
268 BitArray messageBits;
269 GenerateCheckWords(stuffedBits, totalBitsInLayer, wordSize, messageBits);
270
271 // generate mode message
272 int messageSizeInWords = stuffedBits.size() / wordSize;
273 BitArray modeMessage;
274 GenerateModeMessage(compact, layers, messageSizeInWords, modeMessage);
275
276 // allocate symbol
277 int baseMatrixSize = (compact ? 11 : 14) + layers * 4; // not including alignment lines
278 std::vector<int> alignmentMap(baseMatrixSize, 0);
279 int matrixSize;
280 if (compact) {
281 // no alignment marks in compact mode, alignmentMap is a no-op
282 matrixSize = baseMatrixSize;
283 for (int i = 0; i < (int)alignmentMap.size(); i++) {
284 alignmentMap[i] = i;
285 }
286 }
287 else {
288 matrixSize = baseMatrixSize + 1 + 2 * ((baseMatrixSize / 2 - 1) / 15);
289 int origCenter = baseMatrixSize / 2;
290 int center = matrixSize / 2;
291 for (int i = 0; i < origCenter; i++) {
292 int newOffset = i + i / 15;
293 alignmentMap[origCenter - i - 1] = center - newOffset - 1;
294 alignmentMap[origCenter + i] = center + newOffset + 1;
295 }
296 }
297
298 EncodeResult output{compact, matrixSize, layers, messageSizeInWords, BitMatrix(matrixSize)};
299
300 BitMatrix& matrix = output.matrix;
301
302 // draw data bits
303 for (int i = 0, rowOffset = 0; i < layers; i++) {
304 int rowSize = (layers - i) * 4 + (compact ? 9 : 12);
305 for (int j = 0; j < rowSize; j++) {
306 int columnOffset = j * 2;
307 for (int k = 0; k < 2; k++) {
308 if (messageBits.get(rowOffset + columnOffset + k)) {
309 matrix.set(alignmentMap[i * 2 + k], alignmentMap[i * 2 + j]);
310 }
311 if (messageBits.get(rowOffset + rowSize * 2 + columnOffset + k)) {
312 matrix.set(alignmentMap[i * 2 + j], alignmentMap[baseMatrixSize - 1 - i * 2 - k]);
313 }
314 if (messageBits.get(rowOffset + rowSize * 4 + columnOffset + k)) {
315 matrix.set(alignmentMap[baseMatrixSize - 1 - i * 2 - k], alignmentMap[baseMatrixSize - 1 - i * 2 - j]);
316 }
317 if (messageBits.get(rowOffset + rowSize * 6 + columnOffset + k)) {
318 matrix.set(alignmentMap[baseMatrixSize - 1 - i * 2 - j], alignmentMap[i * 2 + k]);
319 }
320 }
321 }
322 rowOffset += rowSize * 8;
323 }
324
325 // draw mode message
326 DrawModeMessage(matrix, compact, matrixSize, modeMessage);
327
328 // draw alignment marks
329 if (compact) {
330 DrawBullsEye(matrix, matrixSize / 2, 5);
331 }
332 else {
333 DrawBullsEye(matrix, matrixSize / 2, 7);
334 for (int i = 0, j = 0; i < baseMatrixSize / 2 - 1; i += 15, j += 16) {
335 for (int k = (matrixSize / 2) & 1; k < matrixSize; k += 2) {
336 matrix.set(matrixSize / 2 - j, k);
337 matrix.set(matrixSize / 2 + j, k);
338 matrix.set(k, matrixSize / 2 - j);
339 matrix.set(k, matrixSize / 2 + j);
340 }
341 }
342 }
343 return output;
344}
345
346} // Aztec
347} // ZXing
